reasoning: Retinitis pigmentosa is a rare inherited retinal dystrophy with incidence ~1-2 per 100k per year (accounting for genetic inheritance patterns and diagnoses over lifetime) and prevalence ~0.08% or 80 per 100k. Variable inheritance patterns (autosomal recessive, autosomal dominant, X-linked) affect epidemiology.
source: Foundation Fighting Blindness epidemiological data; peer-reviewed retinal disease studies
